intro: Chamaexiphium, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow or orange flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. Its foliage is typically silver or gray-green, reducing water loss through transpiration.
